contact_name: European Commission, Secretariat-General, Unit SG.C.1 Evaluation, Regulatory Fitness and performance

resources.description: A zip file with all CSV. One CSV per language. It can be opended with Excel easily.
resources.name: All CSV zipped

resources.description: A zip file with all RSS. RSS are grouped by language. Small groups can be joined and big broups can be splited.
resources.name: All RSS zipped

resources.name: RDF distribution

description: The Commission regularly evaluates EU actions (policies, legislation, trade agreements and financial programmes).Evaluations are an essential part of the decision making process. They are required under the Financial Regulation and carried out according to evaluation standards.From the standards, the Commission derives guidelines for its staff to use during the evaluation process including guidance on fitness checks, which assess whether the regulatory framework for a policy sector is fit for purpose.Evaluation results are fed into the Commission Work Programme and disseminated to the European Parliament, the Council and spending administrative authorities. For legislation specifically, the Commission's REFIT regulatory fitness and performance programme identifies opportunities for simplifying existing legislation and reducing administrative burdens.
title: Smart-regulation, Evaluation
name: sg-eims
contact_address: Berlaymont 06/391, 200 Rue de la Loi, B-1049 Brussels, Belgium

<dct:description xml:lang="en">The Commission regularly evaluates EU actions (policies, legislation, trade agreements and financial programmes).Evaluations are an essential part of the decision making process. They are required under the Financial Regulation and carried out according to evaluation standards.From the standards, the Commission derives guidelines for its staff to use during the evaluation process including guidance on fitness checks, which assess whether the regulatory framework for a policy sector is fit for purpose.Evaluation results are fed into the Commission Work Programme and disseminated to the European Parliament, the Council and spending administrative authorities. For legislation specifically, the Commission's REFIT regulatory fitness and performance programme identifies opportunities for simplifying existing legislation and reducing administrative burdens.</dct:description>
